roleset.name: point
roleset.note: POINT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'point' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. No comparison. (from point.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: toward
example.text: Trading is expected to remain subdued as the market awaits tomorrow's release of the jobs data with the hope that it will point toward a decline in interest rates.
example.arg: toward a decline in interest rates

example.name: to
example.text: ``I believe everyday pricing in the current environment doesn't work,'' says [Walter Loeb of Morgan Stanley& Co.]-1, *trace*-1 pointing to soft durable-goods sales.

example.name: at
example.text: They point at the numerous developing-country governments that have inflated, taxed and regulated themselves into despair under successive IMF programs.
example.arg: the numerous developing-country governments that have inflated, taxed and regulated themselves into despair under successive IMF programs

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Investigators say clues collected over the last few days have already pointed them to locations both near and far outside the port city of Aden , but they wo n't say there 's any indication that the plot here goes beyond Yemen 's boarders .
example.arg: clues collected over the last few days
to locations both near and far outside the port city of Aden

roleset.name: point at, define, make an example of

example.name: typical usage
example.text: Drexel Burnham's Mr. Reidy pointed out that ``profits held up in a tough revenue environment.''
example.arg: that profits held up in a tough revenue environment
